meanings.definition: To marry someone of a different race or group.
meanings.sent1: In the past, it was uncommon for people to intermarry with those from different cultures.
meanings.sent2: Many couples today choose to intermarry despite societal norms.
meanings.sent3: The two neighboring villages decided to intermarry to strengthen their bond.
meanings.sent4: The fusion of different traditions when people intermarry can create beautiful new customs.
meanings.sent5: Intermarrying can lead to a rich tapestry of diverse experiences and perspectives.

meanings.definition: To marry within one's own family or social group.
meanings.sent1: Some royal families intermarry to keep power within their bloodline.
meanings.sent2: In some small communities, it is common for people to intermarry due to limited options.
meanings.sent3: The two best friends jokingly agreed to intermarry their future children.
meanings.sent4: Intermarrying within the same social circle can sometimes lead to conflicts.
meanings.sent5: The practice of intermarrying within the family can have both advantages and disadvantages.
